Description: This session will focus on neoadjuvant therapy for three major types of cancer: breast cancer, melanoma, and sarcoma. The panel consists of medical and surgical oncologists who will delve into the critical issues surrounding the assessment of effectiveness of neoadjuvant therapy, specifically focusing on endpoints for evaluation. We will explore the latest advancements in this field and discuss the newest targets and pathways and opportunities for de-escalation of local-regional therapies in cases of exceptional response. This session promises to be enlightening and thought-provoking, shedding light on the evolving landscape of neoadjuvant therapy. Attendees can expect to gain valuable insights from the collective wisdom of the speakers, paving the way for improved treatment strategies and outcomes for patients battling these challenging cancers.
